result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas R Kratz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Remaining confinement time converted to extended supervision.
from J. Skalski, superintendent at St. Croix Correcitonal with proposed Order
filed by Court Reporter Chris Champeau, Dec. 5, 2014 sentencing

Defendant Lucas R Kratz in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sentence statements made. Court sentenced defendant to 6 yr. prison, consisting of 2 yr. confinement and 4 yr. extended supervision. Conditions: Court costs, DNA surcharge. Obtain and maintain full-time employment. Submit DNA sample. Submit random UA's. Payment of court obligations and supervision fees. Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Dept. of Corrections. Eligible for Challenge Academy & Substance Abuse Program. (189 jail credit) Case called 11:05 a.m., adjourned 11:30 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on December 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.
by Probation Agent Corey Endreas, Portage office

Defendant Lucas R Kratz in court, in custody with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Brenda L. Yaskal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. PSI to be completed within 60 days. Sentencing to be set. Bond continued.
and Notice of Right to Seek Post Conviction Relief filed by defendant/counsel
